text: I wanted it to feel like a family
picture I didn't want it to feel too
much like a a sports team photo or an
army sort of photo you know they were
very sort of regimented in linear and so
we talked about how we could break it a
bit and how it gets some rhythm into the
picture and some asymmetry and and it
all came down to things just very little
tiny things we weren't gonna do anything
crazy but just in terms of how you shot
the room rather than going straight on
and making everything symmetrical we
were twisting it a bit and and then also
how we are placing people we wanted some
people sitting some people standing some
kids on parents laps I mean that was a
huge thing for me just to get to get
that realness out of it so after we did
the set up shots we all went to the
reception and if the couple were gonna
have any energy after that we were going
to go into the Rose Garden and just take
take some intimate quick shots so
eventually we went out there we head up
about three and a half minutes to take
some pictures because everything was
like clockwork and it was just one of
those magical moments when you're a
photographer and everything falls into
place and I said finally okay let's go
back you can go back to your thing now
and I said listen just before you go in
let's sit down on these stairs and she
just slumped in between his legs and
there was this moment of where they were
just laughing because they were joking
about how are they they're exhausted and
finally it's all over and and they just
looked each other no just laughing it
was a beautiful moment and when you're
taking the pictures you know you have
something but obviously you have not
time to look at it so it wasn't until I
actually got back to the hotel that I
look to it and it was just like amazing
so very happy moment
